title: How to ensure a method is executed only once per second/minute/hour
body:
The question is pretty straightforward, I want manage how many calls I send to the server per second do I want the method to be executed only once per second (specifically the block making the REST call). How can I achieve that using a Lock or CountdownLatch or perhaps a much better approach.

I should mention that I am working in a Spring environment and might be there is a spring configuration I can use.

What I have tried so far? The plain old Thread.sleep in a synchronized method that makes the rest call and I find it quite ugly to look at.
